relation: The item that is being reviewed. This needs to be a valid schema.org type. * If review is embedded into another schema.org type, using review property, then there is no need to mark up the itemReviewed property.
The actual body of the review.
The author of the review. The reviewer’s name needs to be a valid name.
The date that the review was published, in ISO 8601 date format.
The rating given in this review. A nested schema.org/Rating (or more specific subtype, most typically AggregateRating).
A numerical quality rating for the item.
The highest value allowed in this rating system. * Required if the rating system is not on a 5-point scale. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.
The lowest value allowed in this rating system. * Required if the rating system is not on a 5-point scale. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.
pageTitle: Enabling Rich Snippets for Reviews and Ratings   |   Structured Data   |   Google Developers
textBeforeTable: Review type definition A review is someone's evaluation of something. In addition to the text of the review, the markup can include a reviewRating, which expresses a summary of the review as a numeric value. Reviews We support reviews and ratings for a wide range of schema.org types, including businesses, products, and different creative works such as books or movies. When Google finds valid reviews or ratings markup, we may show a rich snippet that includes stars and other summary info from reviews or ratings. Reviews and ratings are two ways to express an evaluation about a range of items. A review is the evaluation described as text, and a rating is an evaluation described on a numeric scale (such as 1 to 5). A rating can be marked marked up in conjunction with, and as part of, a textual review. Enabling Rich Snippets for Reviews and Ratings Show Navigation Structured Data Testing Tool Testing Your Markup Testing Show Your Site Name in Search
textAfterTable:
Examples Here we show a simple example of restaurant review. Note that itemReviewed property is explicitly described using a schema.org type. Try to use the most specific type for your reviewed items. We are in the process of implementing JSON-LD support for this Rich Snippet type. At the current time, we recommend using microdata or RDFa. Microdata
Legal Seafood
4 stars - "A good seafood place." Bob Smith The seafood is great.
RDFa
Legal Seafood
4 stars - "A good seafood place." Bob Smith The seafood is great.
JSON-LD Alternatively, you can embed a review into another schema.org type, using its review property. Microdata
The Catcher in the Rye
